38 //
39 // BallsInBox is derived from the Environment base class. This class models
40 // obstacles as spheres to provide a simple demo.
41 //
43 
44 #include <fastrack/environment/balls_in_box.h>
45 
46 namespace fastrack {
47 namespace environment {
48 
49 // Derived classes must provide a collision checker which returns true if
50 // and only if the provided position is a valid collision-free configuration.
51 // Provide a separate collision check for each type of tracking error bound.
52 bool BallsInBox::IsValid(const Vector3d& position, const Box& bound) const {
53  if (!initialized_) {
54  ROS_WARN("%s: Tried to collision check an uninitialized BallsInBox.",
55  name_.c_str());
56  return false;
57  }
58 
59  if (position(0) < lower_(0) + bound.x ||
60  position(0) > upper_(0) - bound.x ||
61  position(1) < lower_(1) + bound.y ||
62  position(1) > upper_(1) - bound.y ||
63  position(2) < lower_(2) + bound.z ||
64  position(2) > upper_(2) - bound.z)
65  return false;
66 
67  // Check against each obstacle.
68  // NOTE! Just using a linear search here for simplicity.
69  if (centers_.size() > 100)
70  ROS_WARN_THROTTLE(1.0, "%s: Caution! Linear search may be slowing you down.",
71  name_.c_str());
72 
73  const Vector3d bound_vector(bound.x, bound.y, bound.z);
74  for (size_t ii = 0; ii < centers_.size(); ii++) {
75  const Vector3d& p = centers_[ii];
76 
77  // Find closest point in the tracking bound to the obstacle center.
78  Vector3d closest_point;
79  for (size_t jj = 0; jj < 3; jj++) {
80  closest_point(jj) =
81  std::min(position(jj) + bound_vector(jj),
82  std::max(position(jj) - bound_vector(jj), p(jj)));
83  }
84 
85  // Check distance to closest point.
86  if ((closest_point - p).norm() <= radii_[ii])
87  return false;
88  }
89 
90  return true;
91 }
92 
93 // Update this environment with the information contained in the given
94 // sensor measurement.
95 // NOTE! This function needs to publish on `updated_topic_`.
96 void BallsInBox::SensorCallback(
97  const fastrack_msgs::SensedSpheres::ConstPtr& msg) {
98  // Check list lengths.
99  if (msg->centers.size() != msg->radii.size())
100  ROS_WARN("%s: Malformed SensedSpheres msg.", name_.c_str());
101 
102  const size_t num_obstacles = std::min(msg->centers.size(), msg->radii.size());
103 
104  // Add each unique obstacle to list.
105  // NOTE! Just using a linear search here for simplicity.
106  if (centers_.size() > 100)
107  ROS_WARN_THROTTLE(1.0, "%s: Caution! Linear search may be slowing you down.",
108  name_.c_str());
109 
110  bool any_unique = false;
111  for (size_t ii = 0; ii < num_obstacles; ii++) {
112  const Vector3d p(msg->centers[ii].x, msg->centers[ii].y, msg->centers[ii].z);
113  const double r = msg->radii[ii];
114 
115  // If not unique, discard.
116  bool unique = true;
117  for (size_t jj = 0; jj < centers_.size(); jj++) {
118  if (p.isApprox(centers_[jj], constants::EPSILON) &&
119  std::abs(r - radii_[jj]) < constants::EPSILON) {
120  unique = false;
121  break;
122  }
123  }
124 
125  if (unique) {
126  any_unique = true;
127  centers_.push_back(p);
128  radii_.push_back(r);
129  }
130  }
131 
132  if (any_unique) {
133  // Let the system know this environment has been updated.
134  updated_pub_.publish(std_msgs::Empty());
135 
136  // Visualize.
137  Visualize();
138  }
139 }
140 
141 // Generate a sensor measurement as a service response.
142 fastrack_msgs::SensedSpheres BallsInBox::
143 SimulateSensor(const SphereSensorParams& params) const {
144  fastrack_msgs::SensedSpheres msg;
145 
146  // Check each obstacle and, if in range, add to response.
147  geometry_msgs::Vector3 c;
148  for (size_t ii = 0; ii < centers_.size(); ii++) {
149  if ((params.position - centers_[ii]).norm() < params.range + radii_[ii]) {
150  c.x = centers_[ii](0);
151  c.y = centers_[ii](1);
152  c.z = centers_[ii](2);
153 
154  msg.centers.push_back(c);
155  msg.radii.push_back(radii_[ii]);
156  }
157  }
158 
159  return msg;
160 }
161 
162 // Derived classes must have some sort of visualization through RViz.
163 void BallsInBox::Visualize() const {
164  if (vis_pub_.getNumSubscribers() <= 0)
165  return;
166 
167  // Set up box marker.
168  visualization_msgs::Marker cube;
169  cube.ns = "cube";
170  cube.header.frame_id = fixed_frame_;
171  cube.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
172  cube.id = 0;
173  cube.type = visualization_msgs::Marker::CUBE;
174  cube.action = visualization_msgs::Marker::ADD;
175  cube.color.a = 0.5;
176  cube.color.r = 0.3;
177  cube.color.g = 0.7;
178  cube.color.b = 0.7;
179 
180  geometry_msgs::Point center;
181 
182  // Fill in center and scale.
183  cube.scale.x = upper_(0) - lower_(0);
184  center.x = lower_(0) + 0.5 * cube.scale.x;
185 
186  cube.scale.y = upper_(1) - lower_(1);
187  center.y = lower_(1) + 0.5 * cube.scale.y;
188 
189  cube.scale.z = upper_(2) - lower_(2);
190  center.z = lower_(2) + 0.5 * cube.scale.z;
191 
192  cube.pose.position = center;
193  cube.pose.orientation.x = 0.0;
194  cube.pose.orientation.y = 0.0;
195  cube.pose.orientation.z = 0.0;
196  cube.pose.orientation.w = 1.0;
197 
198  // Publish cube marker.
199  vis_pub_.publish(cube);
200 
201  // Visualize obstacles as spheres.
202  for (size_t ii = 0; ii < centers_.size(); ii++){
203  visualization_msgs::Marker sphere;
204  sphere.ns = "sphere";
205  sphere.header.frame_id = fixed_frame_;
206  sphere.header.stamp = ros::Time::now();
207  sphere.id = static_cast<int>(ii);
208  sphere.type = visualization_msgs::Marker::SPHERE;
209  sphere.action = visualization_msgs::Marker::ADD;
210 
211  sphere.scale.x = 2.0 * radii_[ii];
212  sphere.scale.y = 2.0 * radii_[ii];
213  sphere.scale.z = 2.0 * radii_[ii];
214 
215  sphere.color.a = 0.9;
216  sphere.color.r = 0.7;
217  sphere.color.g = 0.5;
218  sphere.color.b = 0.5;
219 
220  geometry_msgs::Point p;
221  const Vector3d point = centers_[ii];
222  p.x = point(0);
223  p.y = point(1);
224  p.z = point(2);
225 
226  sphere.pose.position = p;
227 
228  // Publish sphere marker.
229  vis_pub_.publish(sphere);
230  ros::Duration(0.01).sleep();
231  }
232 }
233 
234 // Load parameters. This may be overridden by derived classes if needed
235 // (they should still call this one via Environment::LoadParameters).
236 bool BallsInBox::LoadParameters(const ros::NodeHandle& n) {
237  if (!Environment<fastrack_msgs::SensedSpheres, SphereSensorParams>::
238  LoadParameters(n))
239  return false;
240 
241  ros::NodeHandle nl(n);
242 
243  // Number/size of obstacles.
244  int num; double min_radius, max_radius;
245  if (!nl.getParam("env/num_obstacles", num)) return false;
246  if (!nl.getParam("env/min_radius", min_radius)) return false;
247  if (!nl.getParam("env/max_radius", max_radius)) return false;
248 
249  // Random seed.
250  int seed;
251  if (!nl.getParam("env/seed", seed)) return false;
252 
253  // Generate obstacles.
254  GenerateObstacles(static_cast<size_t>(num), min_radius, max_radius, seed);
255 
256  return true;
257 }
258 
259 // Generate random obstacles.
260 void BallsInBox::GenerateObstacles(
261  size_t num, double min_radius, double max_radius, unsigned int seed) {
262  // Create a random number generator.
263  std::random_device rd;
264  std::default_random_engine rng(rd());
265  rng.seed(seed);
266 
267  // Set up x/y/z and radius distributions.
268  std::uniform_real_distribution<double> unif_x(lower_(0), upper_(0));
269  std::uniform_real_distribution<double> unif_y(lower_(1), upper_(1));
270  std::uniform_real_distribution<double> unif_z(lower_(2), upper_(2));
271  std::uniform_real_distribution<double> unif_r(min_radius, max_radius);
272 
273  // Create obstacles.
274  for (size_t ii = 0; ii < num; ii++) {
275  centers_.push_back(Vector3d(unif_x(rng), unif_y(rng), unif_z(rng)));
276  radii_.push_back(unif_r(rng));
277  }
278 }
279

281 } //\namespace fastrack
